sen.j: 荻野 吟子（おぎの ぎんこ（本名：荻野ぎん）、1851年4月4日（嘉永4年3月3日 (旧暦)） - 1913年（大正2年）6月23日）は、近代日本における日本初の一覧の女性の医師である。
sen.e: Ginko OGINO (real name: Gin OGINO/ April 4, 1851-June 23, 1913) was the first female doctor in modern Japan.
Ginko OGINO (real name: Gin OGINO/ April 4, 1851-June 23, 1913) was the first female doctor in modern Japan.
Ginko OGINO (real name: Gin OGINO/ April 4, 1851-June 23, 1913) was the first female doctor in modern Japan.

sen.j: フェミニストとしても知られる。
sen.e: She is also known as a feminist.
She is also known as a feminist.
She is also known as a feminist.

sen.j: 生涯
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Biography

sen.j: - 武蔵国幡羅郡（はたらぐん）俵瀬（たわらせ）村（現在の埼玉県熊谷市俵瀬、2005年9月30日までは大里郡妻沼町大字俵瀬）に、代々苗字帯刀を許された名主の荻野綾三郎、嘉与（かよ）の五女（末娘）として生を享ける。
sen.e: She was born to Ayajiro OGINO, village headman who had been allowed to adopt surname and wear a pair of sword for generations, and Kayo OGINO as their fifth daughter (youngest daughter) in the village of Tawarase, Hatara County, Musashi Province (currently, Tawarase, Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture/ until Sept 30, 2005: Oaza Tawarase, Menuma-machi, Osato-gun).

She was born to Ayazaburo OGINO, village headman who had been allowed to adopt surname and wear a pair of sword for generations, and Kayo OGINO as their fifth daughter (youngest daughter) in the village of Tawarase, Hatara County, Musashi Province (currently, Tawarase, Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture/ until Sept 30, 2005: Oaza Tawarase, Menuma-machi, Osato-gun).
sen.cmt: 「綾三郎」の読み方が誤っていると思いますので修正しました。
sen.e: She was born to Ayazaburo OGINO, village headman who had been allowed to adopt surname and wear a pair of sword for generations, and Kayo OGINO as their fifth daughter (youngest daughter) in the village of Tawarase, Hatara County, Musashi Province (currently, Tawarase, Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture/ until Sept 30, 2005: Oaza Tawarase, Menuma-machi, Osato-gun).

sen.j: - 望まれて武蔵国北埼玉郡上川上村（現在の熊谷市上川上）の名主の長男稲村貫一郎（のちの足利銀行初代頭取）と結婚。
sen.e: She married to Kanichiro INAMURA (later, the first president of Ashikaga Bank), the eldest son of the headman of the village of Kawakami, Kita-Saitama County, Musashi Province (currently, Kamikawakami, Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture), upon his request.

She married to Kanichiro INAMURA (later, the first president of Ashikaga Bank), the eldest son of the headman of the village of Kamikawakami, Kita-Saitama County, Musashi Province (currently, Kamikawakami, Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture), upon his request.
sen.cmt: 「上川上村」の訳が誤っていましたので訂正しました。
sen.e: She married to Kanichiro INAMURA (later, the first president of Ashikaga Bank), the eldest son of the headman of the village of Kamikawakami, Kita-Saitama County, Musashi Province (currently, Kamikawakami, Kumagaya City, Saitama Prefecture), upon his request.

sen.j: - 夫からうつされた淋病がもとで離婚。
sen.e: She got divorced because of gonorrhea, which she was infected by her husband.
She got divorced because of gonorrhea, which she became infected with by her husband.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。（infectの使い方）
sen.e: She got divorced because of gonorrhea, which she became infected with by her husband.

sen.j: 上京し順天堂医院に入院し婦人科治療をうけるが、そのとき治療にあたった医師がすべて男性だった。
sen.e: She was hospitalized in Juntendo Hospital in Tokyo to receive gynecological treatment, which was given by only male doctors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: She was hospitalized in Juntendo Hospital in Tokyo to receive gynecological treatment, which was given by only male doctors.
She was hospitalized in Juntendo Hospital in Tokyo to receive gynecological treatment, which was given by only male doctors.

sen.j: 男性医師に下半身を晒して診察される屈辱的な体験から、女医となって同じ羞恥に苦しむ女性たちを救いたいという決意により、女医を志す。
sen.e: From her humiliating experience of exposing her lower body to male doctors for treatment, she decided to become a female doctor so that she could rescue women from suffering the same humiliating experience.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: From her humiliating experience of exposing her lower body to male doctors for treatment, she decided to become a female doctor so that she could rescue women from suffering the same humiliating experience.

From her humiliating experience of exposing her lower body to male doctors for treatment, she decided to become a female doctor so that she could rescue women from suffering the same humiliating experience.

sen.j: - 上京し、国学者で皇漢医の井上頼圀（よりくに）に師事。
sen.e: She migrated to Tokyo and studied under Yorikuni INOUE, a scholar of Japanese classical literature and Chinese-medicine doctor.
She migrated to Tokyo and studied under Yorikuni INOUE, a scholar of Japanese classical literature and Chinese-medicine doctor.
She migrated to Tokyo and studied under Yorikuni INOUE, a scholar of Japanese classical literature and Chinese-medicine doctor.

sen.j: 頼圀より後妻に望まれる。
sen.e: She was asked by Yorikuni to become his second wife.
She was asked by Yorikuni to become his second wife.
She was asked by Yorikuni to become his second wife.

sen.j: - 甲府の内藤満寿子の私塾の教師となる。
sen.e: She worked as a teacher at a private school managed by Misuko NAITO in Kofu.
She worked as a teacher at a private school managed by Masuko NAITO in Kofu.
sen.cmt: 「満寿子」の一般的読み方は「ますこ」だと思いますので修正しました。
sen.e: She worked as a teacher at a private school managed by Masuko NAITO in Kofu.

sen.j: - 東京女子師範学校（お茶の水女子大学の前身）の一期生として入学。
sen.e: She enrolled Tokyo Joshi Shihan Gakko (Tokyo Women's Normal School/predecessor of Ochanomizu University) as one of its inaugural students.
She enrolled Tokyo Joshi Shihan Gakko (Tokyo Women's Normal School/predecessor of Ochanomizu University) as one of its inaugural students.
She enrolled Tokyo Joshi Shihan Gakko (Tokyo Women's Normal School/predecessor of Ochanomizu University) as one of its inaugural students.

sen.j: - 首席で卒業。
sen.e: She graduated at the top of her class from the school.
She graduated at the top of her class from the school.
She graduated at the top of her class from the school.

sen.j: 同学校の永井久一郎教授紹介により軍医監で子爵の石黒忠悳（ただのり）に女医の必要性を解く。
sen.e: Through her school's Professor Hisaichiro NAGAI's introduction, she got acquainted with Tadanori ISHIGURO, high-rank Surgeon General and viscount, to whom she appealed the necessity of female doctors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Through her school's Professor Hisaichiro NAGAI's introduction, she got acquainted with Tadanori ISHIGURO, high-rank Surgeon General and viscount, to whom she appealed the necessity of female doctors.

Through her school's Professor Hisaichiro NAGAI's introduction, she got acquainted with Tadanori ISHIGURO, high-rank Surgeon General and viscount, to whom she appealed the necessity of female doctors.

sen.j: 石黒を介して、典薬寮出身で侍医の高階経徳が経営する下谷練塀（ねりべい）町（現在の秋葉原）の私立医学校・好寿院に特別に入学を許される。
sen.e: Through Ishiguro's introduction, she was specially allowed to enroll the Koju-in College, a private medical school in Shitaya Neribe-machi (present Akihabara), which was run by Tsunenori TAKASHINA, a court physician who worked at Tenyakuryo (the Bureau of Medicine).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Through ISHIGURO's introduction, she was specially allowed to enroll the Koju-in College, a private medical school in Shitaya Neribei-machi (present Akihabara), which was run by Tsunenori TAKASHINA, a court physician who worked at Tenyakuryo (the Bureau of Medicine).
sen.cmt: 人名名字を大文字化し、「ねりべい町」のスペルを修正しました。
sen.e: Through ISHIGURO's introduction, she was specially allowed to enroll the Koju-in College, a private medical school in Shitaya Neribei-machi (present Akihabara), which was run by Tsunenori TAKASHINA, a court physician who worked at Tenyakuryo (the Bureau of Medicine).

sen.j: 男子学生に混じり様々ないじめや苦労の艱難辛苦を舐めつつ 3 年間で優秀な成績で修了する。
sen.e: Being only woman among male students, she experienced various types of bullying and went through hardship and troubles, but she graduated with excellent results in three years.
Being only woman among male students, she experienced various types of bullying and went through hardship and troubles, but she graduated with excellent results in three years.
Being only woman among male students, she experienced various types of bullying and went through hardship and troubles, but she graduated with excellent results in three years.

sen.j: しかし、女性であることより、東京府に医術開業試験願を提出したが却下、翌年も同様であった。
sen.e: However, her application for the general practitioner tests was rejected by the Tokyo metropolitan government on the ground of her sex, followed by the same result in the following year.
However, her application for the general practitioner tests was rejected by the Tokyo metropolitan government on the ground of her gender, followed by the same result in the following year.
sen.cmt: 「女性であることを理由に」というところで、社会的な「性」について言っているので、sex よりもgenderの方が相応しいかと思いますので修正しました。
sen.e: However, her application for the general practitioner tests was rejected by the Tokyo metropolitan government on the ground of her gender, followed by the same result in the following year.

sen.j: つづいて埼玉県にも提出したが同じ結果だった。
sen.e: She then submitted application to Saitama Prefecture, but her application was rejected as in Tokyo.
She then submitted application to Saitama Prefecture, but her application was rejected as in Tokyo.
She then submitted application to Saitama Prefecture, but her application was rejected as in Tokyo.

sen.j: この頃のことを、吟子は『女学雑誌』 354 号にこのように書いている。
sen.e: She wrote about her recollection of this period in "Feminist Journal" (345th issue) as follows:
She wrote about her recollection of this period in "Feminist Journal" (345th issue) as follows:
She wrote about her recollection of this period in "Feminist Journal" (345th issue) as follows:

sen.j: 「...願書は再び呈して再び却下されたり。」
sen.e: "I reapplied for the tests, but my request was rejected again.
"I reapplied for the tests, but my request was rejected again."
"I reapplied for the tests, but my request was rejected again."

sen.j: 「思うに余は生てより斯の如く窮せしことはあらざりき。」
sen.e: I have never gone through troubles of this extent in the past.
"I have never gone through troubles of this extent in the past."
"I have never gone through troubles of this extent in the past."

sen.j: 「恐らくは今後もあらざるべし。」
sen.e: I probably will go through troubles of this extend in the future.
"I will probably not go through troubles of this extent in the future."
sen.cmt: 文法、誤訳を修正しました。
sen.e: "I will probably not go through troubles of this extent in the future."

sen.j: 「時方に孟秋の暮つかた、籬落の菊花綾を布き、万朶の梢錦をまとうのとき、天寒く霜気瓦を圧す。」
sen.e: As the day ebbs in autumn--a season when chrysanthemum blooms under the hedge, and creeping branches exude a scarlet hue--, it becomes colder, and tiles are covered with chilly air.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "As the day ebbs in autumn (a season when chrysanthemum blooms under the hedge, and creeping branches exude a scarlet hue), it becomes colder, and tiles are covered with chilly air."
sen.cmt: 読みやすく修正しました。
sen.e: "As the day ebbs in autumn (a season when chrysanthemum blooms under the hedge, and creeping branches exude a scarlet hue), it becomes colder, and tiles are covered with chilly air."

sen.j: 「されども誰に向かってか衣の薄きを訴えん。」
sen.e: But, to whom can I complain that I have no warm clothing?
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "But, to whom can I complain that I have no warm clothing?"
"But, to whom can I complain that I have no warm clothing?"

sen.j: 「満月秋風 独り悵然として高丘に上れば、烟は都下幾万の家ににぎはう。」
sen.e: Feeling disappointment, I go up to the top of the hill at full moon in an autumn breeze and see smoke coming from millions of bustling houses in downtown.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "Feeling disappointment, I go up to the top of the hill at full moon in an autumn breeze and see smoke coming from millions of bustling houses in downtown."
"Feeling disappointment, I go up to the top of the hill at full moon in an autumn breeze and see smoke coming from millions of bustling houses in downtown."

sen.j: 「されど、予が為めに一飯を供するなし。」
sen.e: But there are no ones who offer dinner for me.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "But there are no ones who offer dinner for me."
"But there are no ones who offer dinner for me."

sen.j: 「...親戚朋友嘲罵は一度び予に向かって湧ぬ、進退是れ谷まり百術総て尽きぬ。」
sen.e: Relatives and friends again laugh at me, and I am in dead end, with escape strategies eluding me again.
"Relatives and friends again laugh at me, and I am in dead end, with escape strategies eluding me again."
"Relatives and friends again laugh at me, and I am in dead end, with escape strategies eluding me again."

sen.j: 「肉落ち骨枯れて心神いよいよ激昂す。」
sen.e: My body becomes lean, my guts are exhausted, and my mind is going crazy.
"My body becomes lean, my guts are exhausted, and my mind is going crazy."
"My body becomes lean, my guts are exhausted, and my mind is going crazy."

sen.j: 「見ずや中流一岩の起つあるは却て是れ怒涛盤滑を捲かしむるのしろなるを。」
sen.e: The flow is blocked by the rock standing in the middle, and can I see the omen that high tide will wash through the rock?"
"The flow is blocked by the rock standing in the middle, and I'm beginning to see that the rock is there to further whirl the raging flow rather than stop it."
sen.cmt: この部分は「岩が川の中流にあるのは、それを止めるためではなく、却って水を旋回させて勢いを増すためだとわかった」転じて、「医師になるために努力する中、色々と解決策が見つかりそうになっては結局挫折し、失望感や怒りが却って大きくなる」という意味だと考え、そのように修正しました。
sen.e: "The flow is blocked by the rock standing in the middle, and I'm beginning to see that the rock is there to further whirl the raging flow rather than stop it."

sen.j: この文面より吟子の万策尽きた様子が伺われる。
sen.e: It can be known from these sentences that Ginko was at the end of her tether.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It can be known from these sentences that Ginko was at the end of her tether.
It can be known from these sentences that Ginko was at the end of her tether.

sen.j: 開業への思いは強く最後の手段として外国での資格取得も考えていたようである。
sen.e: Her resolution to become a general practitioner, however, was strong, and she seems to have planned to get certified under overseas institutions as the last ditch effort.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Her resolution to become a general practitioner, however, was strong, and she seems to have planned to get certified under overseas institutions as the last ditch effort.
Her resolution to become a general practitioner, however, was strong, and she seems to have planned to get certified under overseas institutions as the last ditch effort.

sen.j: 開業試験願を却下され窮地に陥っている吟子に同情した実業家の高島嘉右衛門は、井上頼圀に依頼して内務省衛生局局長、長与専斎を紹介。
sen.e: Kaemon TAKASHIMA, an entrepreneur, sympathized with Ginko, who was cornered because of the rejection of GP test application, and introduced Sensai NAGAYO, head of Hygiene Bureau at the Ministry of Home Affairs, to Ginko, through Yorikuni INOUE.

Kaemon TAKASHIMA, an entrepreneur, sympathized with Ginko, who was cornered because of the rejection of GP test application, and introduced Sensai NAGAYO, head of Hygiene Bureau at the Ministry of Home Affairs, to Ginko, through Yorikuni INOUE.

Kaemon TAKASHIMA, an entrepreneur, sympathized with Ginko, who was cornered because of the rejection of GP test application, and introduced Sensai NAGAYO, head of Hygiene Bureau at the Ministry of Home Affairs, to Ginko, through Yorikuni INOUE.

sen.j: 吟子は好寿院に入る際にいろいろの書物を捜した末『令義解』という本に、日本でも古代から女医らしい者があったことを突きとめた。
sen.e: When enrolling the Koju-in College, Ginko read various books and discovered in the book "Ryo-no-gige" (commentary on the Ryo) that there were female doctor-like persons in Japan from ancient times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When enrolling the Koju-in College, Ginko read various books and discovered in the book "Ryo-no-gige" (commentary on the Ryo) that there were female doctor-like persons in Japan from ancient times.
When enrolling the Koju-in College, Ginko read various books and discovered in the book "Ryo-no-gige" (commentary on the Ryo) that there were female doctor-like persons in Japan from ancient times.

sen.j: このことを強調し請願をした。
sen.e: When applying for the GP tests, she emphasized this point.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When applying for the GP tests, she emphasized this point.
When applying for the GP tests, she emphasized this point.

sen.j: 併せて高島嘉右衛門は、井上頼圀に依頼して、古代からの女医の史実を調査してもらった。
sen.e: Kaemon TAKASHIMA, meanwhile, asked Yorihuni INOUE to examine historical records from ancient times, which described about female doctor-like figures.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Kaemon TAKASHIMA, meanwhile, asked Yorihuni INOUE to examine historical records from ancient times, which mentioned female doctors.
sen.cmt: 原文により忠実になるように修正しました。
sen.e: Kaemon TAKASHIMA, meanwhile, asked Yorihuni INOUE to examine historical records from ancient times, which mentioned female doctors.

sen.j: この資料を添えて長与局長への紹介状を吟子に持たせた。
sen.e: Kaemon instructed Ginko to present to NAGAYO, the head of the bureau, not only a recommendation letter but also results of the above-mentioned surveys.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Kaemon instructed Ginko to present to NAGAYO, the head of the bureau, not only a recommendation letter but also results of the above-mentioned surveys.
Kaemon instructed Ginko to present to NAGAYO, the head of the bureau, not only a recommendation letter but also results of the above-mentioned surveys.

sen.j: 吟子に依頼を受けた石黒忠悳も、責任があるので衛生局へ行き、局長に会って頼んだところ、女は困ると言われた。
sen.e: Tadanori ISHIGURO, feeling responsibility, contacted the head of the bureau upon Ginko's request, and asked for acceptance of her application, but his petition was rejected on the ground that women could not be applicable.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Tadanori ISHIGURO, feeling responsibility, contacted the head of the bureau upon Ginko's request, and asked for acceptance of her application, but his petition was rejected on the ground that women could not be applicable.

Tadanori ISHIGURO, feeling responsibility, contacted the head of the bureau upon Ginko's request, and asked for acceptance of her application, but his petition was rejected on the ground that women could not be applicable.

sen.j: しかし、以下のように喰いさがったそうである。
sen.e: It is said that Tadanori made a die-hard effort to protest as follows:
sen.cmt: 英文の流れで、原文の順番を少し入れ替えました。
sen.e: It is said that Tadanori made a die-hard effort to protest as follows:
It is said that Tadanori made a die-hard effort to protest as follows:

sen.j: 「女が医者になってはいけないという条文があるか。」
sen.e: "Is there any laws that ban women from becoming doctors?"
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "Is there any laws that ban women from becoming doctors?"
"Is there any laws that ban women from becoming doctors?"

sen.j: 「無い以上は受けさせて及第すれば開業させてもよいではないか。」
sen.e: "Since there are no such kind of rules, why don't you let women take exams and allow them to become GPs if they pass exams."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: "Since there are no such kind of rules, why don't you let women take exams and allow them to become GPs if they pass exams."
"Since there are no such kind of rules, why don't you let women take exams and allow them to become GPs if they pass exams."

sen.j: 「女がいけないのなら、『女は医者になる可らず』と書き入れておくべきだ。」
sen.e: "If women are not welcomed, the line that "Women are banned from becoming doctors." should be inserted in laws."
If women are not welcome, a clause that "Women are banned from becoming doctors." should be inserted in laws."
sen.cmt: 英語として自然になるように修正しました。
sen.e: If women are not welcome, a clause that "Women are banned from becoming doctors." should be inserted in laws."

sen.j: こうして吟子と支援者との熱意にうたれた長与局長の計らいで「学力がある以上は、開業試験を受けることを許可して差し支えない」ということになる。
sen.e: Thanks to the help of Bureau Head NAGAYO, who was moved by Ginko and her supporters' passion, it was decided that "It would be all right if we allow women to take the GP tests as long as they have knowledge and skills."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Thanks to the help of Bureau Head NAGAYO, who was moved by Ginko and her supporters' passion, it was decided that "It would be all right if we allow women to take the GP tests as long as they have knowledge and skills."

Thanks to the help of Bureau Head NAGAYO, who was moved by Ginko and her supporters' passion, it was decided that "It would be all right if we allow women to take the GP tests as long as they have knowledge and skills."

sen.j: 明治17年に「女医公許」が決定しようやく受験が認められる。
sen.e: In 1884, "the authorization of certification of female doctors" was decided, and Ginko was finally allowed to take the examinations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1884, "the authorization of certification of female doctors" was decided, and Ginko was finally allowed to take the examinations.
In 1884, "the authorization of certification of female doctors" was decided, and Ginko was finally allowed to take the examinations.
September, 1884:
September, 1884:
September, 1884:

sen.j: - 前期試験を他の女性 3 人と受験、吟子 1 人のみ合格。
sen.e: Three women including Ginko took the first half of the GP tests and only Ginko passed the exams.
Three women including Ginko took the first half of the GP tests and only Ginko passed the exams.
Three women including Ginko took the first half of the GP tests and only Ginko passed the exams.
March, 188５:
March, 188５:
March, 188５:

sen.j: - 後期試験を受験し合格。
sen.e: She took the last half of the GP tests and passed the exams.
She took the last half of the GP tests and passed the exams.
She took the last half of the GP tests and passed the exams.

sen.j: 同年 5 月、湯島に診療所「産婦人科荻野医院」を開業。
sen.e: In May 1885, she opened 'Ogino Gynecology Clinic' in Yushima.
In May 1885, she opened 'Ogino Gynecology Clinic' in Yushima.
In May 1885, she opened 'Ogino Gynecology Clinic' in Yushima.

sen.j: 34歳にして、近代日本初の公許女医となる。
sen.e: At the age of 34, she became the first certified female doctor in modern Japan.
At the age of 34, she became the first certified female doctor in modern Japan.
At the age of 34, she became the first certified female doctor in modern Japan.

sen.j: 女医を志して 15 年が経過していた。
sen.e: It passed 15 years since she had aspired to be a female doctor.
15 years had passed since she aspired to be a female doctor.
15 years had passed since she aspired to be a female doctor.

sen.j: そのときすでに父はもとより、母も前月に他界していた。
sen.e: His father had already died, and her mother passed away one month before Ginko's certification.
His father had already died, and her mother passed away one month before Ginko's certification.
His father had already died, and her mother passed away one month before Ginko's certification.

sen.j: 吟子のことは新聞や雑誌で「女医第一号」として大きく扱われる。
sen.e: Ginko grabbed the headlines of newspapers and magazines as 'the first female doctor.'
Ginko grabbed the headlines of newspapers and magazines as 'the first female doctor.'
Ginko grabbed the headlines of newspapers and magazines as 'the first female doctor.'

sen.j: 診療所は、繁盛し場所が手狭なため、翌年下谷に移転する。
sen.e: Her clinic did good business, and Ginko moved out to Shitaya and opened a bigger clinic next year because the former clinic was too small.
Her clinic thrived, and Ginko moved to Shitaya and opened a bigger clinic next year because the former clinic became too small.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正し、口語表現を改めました。
sen.e: Her clinic thrived, and Ginko moved to Shitaya and opened a bigger clinic next year because the former clinic became too small.

sen.j: 開業当初は第1号女医と新聞や雑誌にもてはやされ、一時は患者にあふれた。
sen.e: The first few years after the open of the clinic, Ginko was a darling of newspapers and magazines as the first female doctor, and her clinic was crowded with patients for a while.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: During first few years after the opening of the clinic, Ginko was the darling of newspapers and magazines as the first female doctor, and her clinic was crowded with patients for a while.
During first few years after the opening of the clinic, Ginko was the darling of newspapers and magazines as the first female doctor, and her clinic was crowded with patients for a while.

sen.j: しかし、当時は中産階級以下の者は医者にかかることなく祈祷師や民間療法に頼る時代であった。
sen.e: The common practice at that time, however, was that people below the middle class consulted not with doctors but with witch doctors or count on folk remedies.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The common practice at that time, however, was that people below the middle class consulted with witch doctors or counted on folk remedies rather than went to a clinic to see a doctor.
sen.cmt: より自然な英語表現に修正しました。
sen.e: The common practice at that time, however, was that people below the middle class consulted with witch doctors or counted on folk remedies rather than went to a clinic to see a doctor.

sen.j: また保険医療もなく、たとえ患者として受診した者に対しても、高額になる医療費を全ての者に全部支払ってもらうことなど出来ない時代であった。
sen.e: Also, without healthcare, it was very difficult for doctors to ask every patient who had treatment to bear all the expensive medical costs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Also, without healthcare, it was very difficult for doctors to ask every patient who had treatment to bear all the expensive medical costs.
Also, without healthcare, it was very difficult for doctors to ask every patient who had treatment to bear all the expensive medical costs.

sen.j: その上、女性医師は信頼できないという者が多かった。
sen.e: In addition, there were many persons who said they could not rely on female doctors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 （分割対象でなくても、流れから分割しました）
sen.e: In addition, there were many persons who said they could not rely on female doctors.
In addition, there were many persons who said they could not rely on female doctors.

sen.j: 医業では成功しなかったとされる。
sen.e: (From reasons mentioned above) It is said that Ginko was not successful in clinic management business.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (From reasons mentioned above) It is said that Ginko was not very successful in the medical profession.
sen.cmt: 原文の意味を正確に反映できるように修正しました。
sen.e: (From reasons mentioned above) It is said that Ginko was not very successful in the medical profession.

sen.j: しかし、女性に対して医術開業試験への門戸を開いたという意味で、荻野は重要な人物である。
sen.e: However, OGINO was an important person in that she opened the door to the GP tests for women.
However, OGINO was an important person in that she opened the door to the GP tests for women.
However, OGINO was an important person in that she opened the door to the GP tests for women.

sen.j: - 海老名弾正から『日本開化小史』の著書で有名な田口卯吉らとともにキリスト教の洗礼を受ける。
sen.e: Together with Ukitchi TAGUCHI, author of "Nihon kaika shoshi," (literally, small history of Japanese civilization) Ginko was christened by EBINA Danjo.
Together with Ukitchi TAGUCHI, author of "Nihon kaika shoshi," (literally, small history of Japanese civilization) Ginko was christened by EBINA Danjo.
Together with Ukitchi TAGUCHI, author of "Nihon kaika shoshi," (literally, small history of Japanese civilization) Ginko was christened by EBINA Danjo.

sen.j: キリスト教婦人矯風会にも参加し、その風俗部長に就任するとともに、廃娼運動にも取り組む。
sen.e: She joined the Christian Women Ethics Club, worked as the Manner Chief of the club, and got involved in the prostitute abolishment movement.
She joined the Christian Women Ethics Club, worked as the Manner Chief of the club, and got involved in the prostitute abolishment movement.
She joined the Christian Women Ethics Club, worked as the Manner Chief of the club, and got involved in the prostitute abolishment movement.

sen.j: 大日本婦人衛生会幹事。
sen.e: She assumed the post of secretary-general of the Great Japan Women Hygiene Association.
sen.cmt: 大日本婦人衛生会」定訳不明
sen.e: She assumed the post of secretary-general of the Great Japan Women Hygiene Association.
She assumed the post of secretary-general of the Great Japan Women Hygiene Association.
November 25, 1890:
November 25, 1890:
November 25, 1890:

sen.j: - 39 歳の時 13 歳年下の同志社の学生で、新島襄から洗礼を受け敬虔なキリスト教徒だった志方之善（しかたゆきよし）と周囲の反対を押し切り再婚する。
sen.e: At the age of 39, she remarried over opposition to Yukiyoshi SHIKATA, a student of Doshisha University who was 13-year junior to her and a devout Christian who was baptized by Joseph Hardy Neesima (Joe NIIJIMA).

At the age of 39, she remarried over opposition to Yukiyoshi SHIKATA, a student of Doshisha University who was 13-year junior to her and a devout Christian who was baptized by Joseph Hardy Neesima (Joe NIIJIMA).

At the age of 39, she remarried over opposition to Yukiyoshi SHIKATA, a student of Doshisha University who was 13-year junior to her and a devout Christian who was baptized by Joseph Hardy Neesima (Joe NIIJIMA).

sen.j: キリスト教や理想社会を求める互いの熱意に共感し合って幸せな新婚生活であったのも束の間だった。
sen.e: Happy newlywed life, where they were bonded with shared passion for Christianity and ideal society, was ephemeral.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Happy newlywed life, where they were bonded with shared passion for Christianity and ideal society, was ephemeral.
Happy newlywed life, where they were bonded with shared passion for Christianity and ideal society, was ephemeral.

sen.j: 夫の之善はキリスト教徒の理想郷をつくるという信念から北海道へ渡る決意を吟子に告げる。
sen.e: Yukiyoshi revealed to Ginko his resolution to immigrate to Hokkaido to set up Christian utopia there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Yukiyoshi revealed to Ginko his resolution to emigrate to Hokkaido to set up a Christian utopia there.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。（immigrateとemigrateの語法）
sen.e: Yukiyoshi revealed to Ginko his resolution to emigrate to Hokkaido to set up a Christian utopia there.

sen.j: - 之善は利別原野開拓のために単身で渡道する。
sen.e: Yukiyoshi alone immigrated to Hokkaido to reclaim wasteland in Toshibetsu.
Yukiyoshi emigrated to Hokkaido on his own to develop wasteland in Toshibetsu.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正し、より英語的表現に修正しました。
sen.e: Yukiyoshi emigrated to Hokkaido on his own to develop wasteland in Toshibetsu.

sen.j: - 翌年いったん戻ったが再び渡道。
sen.e: He temporarily returned to Tokyo, but again migrated to Hokkaido.
He temporarily returned to Tokyo, but again went to Hokkaido.
sen.cmt: 英語としてより自然な表現に修正しました。
sen.e: He temporarily returned to Tokyo, but again went to Hokkaido.

sen.j: 吟子も診療所をたたみ、数年おくれて之善のいるイマヌエル（今金町）へ渡った。
sen.e: Ginko closed her clinic and migrated--several years after Yukiyoshi's immigration--to Inumaeru (Imagane town), where Yukiyoshi lived.
Ginko closed her clinic and migrated (several years after Yukiyoshi's emigration) to Inumaeru (Imagane town), where Yukiyoshi lived.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。（immigrateとemigrateの語法）
sen.e: Ginko closed her clinic and migrated (several years after Yukiyoshi's emigration) to Inumaeru (Imagane town), where Yukiyoshi lived.

sen.j: 北海道の密林と原野を開拓して理想郷を創造するというこの仕事は、実際には困難を極めた。
sen.e: The tasks of cultivating woodland and wasteland in Hokkaido and building utopia were, in reality, a very troublesome endeavor.
The tasks of cultivating woodland and wasteland in Hokkaido and building a utopia were, in reality, a very troublesome endeavor.
The tasks of cultivating woodland and wasteland in Hokkaido and building a utopia were, in reality, a very troublesome endeavor.

sen.j: さまざまな経緯はあるが、結果的には之善の試みは挫折に終る。
sen.e: Yukiyoshi's initiative, after going through various episodes, ended up with failure in the event.
Yukiyoshi's initiative, after going through various episodes, ended up with failure in the event.
Yukiyoshi's initiative, after going through various episodes, ended up with failure in the event.

sen.j: 吟子は海辺の瀬棚に移転して合津町で診療所を開業する。
sen.e: Ginko moved out to Setana, a coastal town, and opened a clinic in the Aitsu-cyo district.
Ginko moved to Setana, a coastal county, and opened a clinic in the Aitsu-cyo town.
Ginko moved to Setana, a coastal county, and opened a clinic in the Aitsu-cyo town.

sen.j: 国縫のマンガン鉱の開発にも失敗した之善は、京都の同志社へ再入学した。
sen.e: Yukiyoshi, who had failed also in the development of a manganese mine in Kunnui area, reentered Doshisha University in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Yukiyoshi, who had failed also in the development of a manganese mine in Kunnui area, reentered Doshisha University in Kyoto.
Yukiyoshi, who had failed also in the development of a manganese mine in Kunnui area, reentered Doshisha University in Kyoto.

sen.j: 卒業して牧師として北海道浦河教会に赴任した。
sen.e: After graduation, he was dispatched to Urakawa Church in Hokkaido as a preacher.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After graduation, he was dispatched to Urakawa Church in Hokkaido as a preacher.
After graduation, he was dispatched to Urakawa Church in Hokkaido as a preacher.

sen.j: - 之善は無理がたたって敗残の思いの中、病死。
sen.e: Yukiyoshi died from illness caused by overwork while feeling defeat.
Yukiyoshi died from illness caused by overwork while feeling defeat.
Yukiyoshi died from illness caused by overwork while feeling defeat.

sen.j: 吟子はその後も 3 年間瀬棚で過ごす。
sen.e: Ginko continued to live in Setana for three years after Yukiyoshi's death.
Ginko continued to live in Setana for three years after Yukiyoshi's death.
Ginko continued to live in Setana for three years after Yukiyoshi's death.

sen.j: - 帰京、本所区小梅町に医院を開業し晩年を送る。
sen.e: She returned to Tokyo and opened a clinic in the Koume district in Honjo Ward, where she spent her last years.
She returned to Tokyo and opened a clinic in the Koume town in Honjo Ward, where she spent her last years.
sen.cmt: 「小梅町」は'district' より'town'が相応しいと判断し、修正しました。
sen.e: She returned to Tokyo and opened a clinic in the Koume town in Honjo Ward, where she spent her last years.

sen.j: - 肋膜炎にかかり、ついで脳動脈硬化により逝去した。
sen.e: She suffered from pleurisy and died from the ensuing cerebral arteriosclerosis.
She suffered from pleurisy and died from the ensuing cerebral arteriosclerosis.
She suffered from pleurisy and died from the ensuing cerebral arteriosclerosis.
She died at the age of 62.
She died at the age of 62.
She died at the age of 62.

sen.j: 女医になる前の3年間の通学は、はかま姿でたかげたをはいていた。
sen.e: During 3-year schooling before becoming a female doctor, she was clad in (men's) hakama clothing and Japanese wooden clogs (geta).
During 3-year schooling before becoming a female doctor, she was clad in (men's) hakama clothing and Japanese wooden clogs (geta).
During 3-year schooling before becoming a female doctor, she was clad in (men's) hakama clothing and Japanese wooden clogs (geta).

sen.j: その頃は女医は認められていないため、ヘアスタイルはショートカットで、 男性と同じ髪型であった。
sen.e: As female doctors were not authorized at that time, she wore short hairstyle same as male students.
As female doctors were not accepted at that time, she had her hair cut short just in the same way as her male classmates.
sen.cmt: 英語としてより自然な表現に修正しました。
sen.e: As female doctors were not accepted at that time, she had her hair cut short just in the same way as her male classmates.
